intro: Phebalium squameum, commonly known as the squamose phebalium, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
